website_summaries.verdict: Perfect for new reptile owners, Zilla’s grassy green terrarium liner is available in a wide range of convenient sizes, soft to the touch, and is easily cleaned by running it under cold tap water.
pros: Available in 10 gallon, 15-20 gallon, 29 gallon, 30 gallon, 40-50 gallon, 55 gallon, 75 gallon, and 125 gallon sizes
cons: Although you’ll probably have to cut this liner to size, it is easy to set up

customer_reviews.title: BIG improvement for my bearded dragons
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my bearded dragon terrarium. They had sand when I first bought them, and it could not be kept clean. They'd constantly track it into their food dish, and no amount of sifting could handle the food particles and waste. I switched over to this repti-mat, I'm happy and the dragons are happy! Every week I remove everything from their terrarium, shake this outside, brush it off, and it's good to go. I replace it every 2-3 months. No more sand in their food, and it's really easy to keep clean. It comes in a large sheet, which you can cut down to size to suit your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Mcfarland

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to replace the sand in my Bearded Dragon's tank because I was concerned with the health risks associated with eating sand. My beardie doesn't seem put off by the new texture change and his nails do not catch on the fabric like other reviews have stated. I have the 36" by 18" terrarium by Exo Terra and only had to trim the length by about an inch for it to fit perfectly. I do plan on getting a second so I have a replacement to swap during thorough deep tank cleanings.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Ball python
customer_reviews.text: I’ve caught hell for using this with what people think they are “Ball Python enthusiasts” but I love it..... I clean my tank once a month, I’ve never had an issue with this. I work long hours and don’t have the time nor want to be all extra with substrate....... this is perfect for me and my BP. I haven’t had an issue of it being dirty or anything of that nature..... I will continue to purchase this
customer_reviews.author: Jacks

customer_reviews.title: but it looks great. I've had the green kind in another tank ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit the tank perfectly, only had to trim about an inch off length-wise. Took some effort to get the curl out of it, but it looks great. I've had the green kind in another tank for a while now, love how easy this stuff is to maintain. Cleaner look and no worries about my beardie kicking coconut fibers all over her food and water dishes anymore!
customer_reviews.author: SunniD

customer_reviews.title: Easy to cut and was enough to fit 2 of my tanks!
customer_reviews.text: I switched from repti-bark to carpet after growing weary of the cleaning hassle. This carpet is easy to clean and my snake actually comes out more frequently! The geckos are pretty much always arboreal so they dont care, but it makes my life easier to clean it! I got a larger roll and was able to cut it to fit an 18x18 and a 12x20 no problem! happy with this purchase and just saved me form having to keep buying more bark!
customer_reviews.author: The Little Mogul Toy Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but slightly long for my 40 gallon tank.
customer_reviews.text: It works well for me. My son's bearded dragon seems to like it and there is nothing toxic that can harm him. The only minor issue for me was that it was a few inches too long for my 40 gallon tank. I tried to just put it in with the extra curling up the sides a little bit. That didn't work out that well though. The crickets kept sneaking under the corners and hiding underneath. I finally had to take it back out and trim off the excess with a pair of scissors. It seems to work fine now.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan - Avid Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended for Juvies
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cost-effective, easy to manage option for substrate, but my Leo kept getting his little teeth caught in it when striking at food. I used it for many years with my previous Leo and I noticed she got caught on it once or twice, but usually the issue she had was mealworms kind of clinging to it. My new gecko is a juvenile so I think that is a factor. Unfortunately, I saw h get stuck to it about five times in one feeding and just couldn't continue using it. You may not have this issue with larger pets, larger feeders, or if you tong/bowl feed.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Works great, odor resistant, fire retardant.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased three of these so far. They all work great and are easy to clean. My tortoises like to dig into it so I was worried about it shredding. It has held up. Once more, the heat lamp fell and burned a hole clear through it (the tortoises are fine.). What could have been a major disaster, was not. It is fire resistant but now I do have a round hole on one end.
customer_reviews.author: nwilkaz

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty high quality
customer_reviews.text: My bearded dragon likes to make his home by scraping off the sand from the sand mat. I thought perhaps he was comfortable and it was time for a floor change. I was a bit worried about his nails getting caught when it first arrived. It was a nice, high quality "cloth", dense and rough. Unfortunately I bought the wrong size and it didn't even cover half of his cage. I ended up lining his little bed room and basking area with it and he seems to like it. No nails are getting stuck just yet. It may not be the material that I'd lay down all over the cage though.
customer_reviews.author: Crispy the King of Bearded Dragons

customer_reviews.title: Mistake at warehouse?
customer_reviews.text: I needed a 40 gallon size but they only sale 50 gallon sizes. I bought it thinking I would have to cut the 50 gallon size to 40 gallon size for my tank but when I got the item it said 40-50 gallons. I opened it and it fit perfectly in my 40 gallon tank so don't buy if you need one for 50 gallons because they probably either put the wrong one in the box or mixed it up in the warehouse. Overall, I got what I needed with no hassle and the product is excellent. Just a heads up to anyone needing a 50 gallon rug size.
customer_reviews.author: YGO993

customer_reviews.title: Safe, attractive, and hassle-free! Perfect for leopard geckos.
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite “substrate” for any leopard gecko terrarium setup that isn’t bioactive. Sand kills, literally... there is NO SUCH THING as a safe sand for leopard geckos! It’s so important that owners understand this. There are other materials that are perfectly suitable, but if you want something tidy, unfussy to install, easy to clean, and easy to replace... this is exactly what you need. Henry (the hairy guy in the background of my attached photo,) and I both agree that Curtis (the hairless guy in foreground,) looks content and comfortable with his freshly replaced carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Evelyn

customer_reviews.title: Baby dragon loves this bedding!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bedding! So easy to keep the habitat clean! Our baby dragon loves it and so do we. Easy to wash and keep his habitat clean. We cut into different size pieces so only the one that he messes on will need to be changed daily. Keep an extra set on hand so the others can dry overnight.
customer_reviews.author: R. Appleby

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd or 4th time buying these carpets for my Breaded Dragon's habitat...buying 2 at a time. I then switch out when one becomes soiled. I'll usually replace the carpets with new ones every 4-6 months...but they'll will last much longer. I normally have to cut about 1" off the length to better fit his tank. Very easy to maintain. I have a small battery operated vacuum that I clean up crumbs etc with. When my Dragon potties...I clean off the solid mess and then machine wash to clean. Air Dry.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Gray

customer_reviews.title: Safe substrate option for your reptile!
customer_reviews.text: After trying many types of substrate for our bearded dragon, we finally settled on these substrate mats. They work great for covering the bottom of the cage and they are pleasing to the eye. When they get soiled, we swap them out (bought two) and wash with warm water and soap. Then we set the rug out to dry in the sun. This is a great safe option for your bearded dragon because there are no particles that could be eaten and they look good in the cage. Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MrNate

customer_reviews.title: Going strong a year later
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 for a standard 10 gallon tank holding a leopard gecko. It is pretty much just a thick piece of felt. We've been using them for almost a year now. Once a week take it out, wash it off with water and a MILD soap. Put in the other piece and let the old dry out. They've both held up nicely and look new. Her claws catch ever so slightly now and then, but it's not very often. Snipped off one side very slightly because her snack mealworms can get under the mat if it's not totally flat.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie Posie

customer_reviews.title: Dragon trap
customer_reviews.text: Fit my 40 gal breeder tank just swell. My beardie always flops himself underneath it and gets stuck though. A bit comical
customer_reviews.author: G.K

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this! In fact I bought two so that I could just swap it out each time I needed to for my dragon. She is able to walk on it just fine. It's super easy to clean (I just spray it off in the shower, roll it up and let it dry on the side). It doesn't adhere to the tank but we have enough things like water dishes and reptile hides that it isn't a problem at all. Another great aspect to this versus tile or linoleum is that you don't have to use any cleaners, just water! This has definitely exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.author: TF

customer_reviews.title: Does get caught on the fabric
customer_reviews.text: My leopard gecko does get her teeth caught on the fabric fibers when lunging for meal worms. This is pretty scary to see and there's not much you can do but wait for them to free themselves after a second. I now feed her on a paper towel only, and she does much better. I haven't noticed her nails getting stuck. The mat looks fine, nothing fancy, but it is durable.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean & looks good
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 iguanas and switched to these soon after getting them as they are extremely easy to clean and sanitize. They help neutralize odors, it's easy to spot clean, and doesn't make a mess like sand and wood chips do. They come in green or brown, in multiple sizes, and can be cut to fit your enclosure. Reptiles don't get their nails or spikes snagged in it either which is a definite plus.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin & DD

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a replacement carpet for my bearded dragons! Fast shipping and receiving due to prime! Took old carpet out and placed new carpet in, dragons are happy! Easy to install (did have to cut to make fit but I don’t have a standard tank) will continue to order my replacement carpets from this company! Recommends to anyone needing a reptile carpet!
customer_reviews.author: Renee Cortese

customer_reviews.title: Our Gecko didn't like it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our juvenile gecko cage. It was exactly as described and fit the cage perfectly. It looked good also. However, the gecko's claws get caught on the carpet when he is hunting the crickets and his teeth get caught sometimes, when he catches the crickets. This has stressed him out. We removed the carpet and put down paper towels. I am not sure if he has to get used to it, and I may try it again when he is older. I've seen other set ups with this carpet and it seems to be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret7472

customer_reviews.title: Safe substrate solution for your reptile!
customer_reviews.text: After trying many types of substrate for our bearded dragon, we finally settled on these substrate mats. They work great for covering the bottom of the cage and they are pleasing to the eye. When they get soiled, we swap them out (bought two) and wash with warm water and soap. Then we set the rug out to dry in the sun. This is a great safe option for your bearded dragon because there are no particles that could be eaten and they look good in the cage. Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MrNate

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: My heart is finally at ease. I got a leopard gecko and quickly learned there is soooo much contradicting information on how to properly care for your gecko. Petco told me get calci sand.... wow... so I learned that is terrible substrate and to use a paper towel, I was like no way. Then i found this, I love it. So does my gecko!
customer_reviews.author: Desteni Shrader

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit my 20 gallon tank
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about buying this product in the same way I learned to distrust bedding for full/queen beds - it's never the truth! This product is perfectly fine except that it is about 2" too short for my tank. Worms crawl under it. The dragon has been able to shift it. Im unhappy and feel like I wasted my money. Brainstorming solutions now...
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: We love this felt. I have two tanks for my bearded dragons and they each have this in the bottom of their tanks. I actually ordered another one for each of their tanks as well so when we clean their tanks out, I can swap the dirty liner for the clean liner instead of waiting to wash one and then replace it. I have already recommended this to several people
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Lasher

customer_reviews.title: Frogs are happy and so green
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my frog tank. I changed up their environment and put this in their tank. They gave been so happy with their new set up. They have been so green. They love to lay on it after they've been in the water. It's nice to change out and it rinses pretty clean in between tank changes. The crickets last longer because they aren't drowning or lousy in other substrates. This has been a good change for us.
customer_reviews.author: Avg-nichol

customer_reviews.title: Great tan color for adding that desert 🌵 feel to your tank & easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: I love the tan color and that it fit our 40G tank with only a slight trim being necessary. I did have to use some double sided tape on the bottom of our Beardie’s tank to help hold it down since it was wanting to roll back up. I’m not sure yet about how easy it will be to clean, but I can update later with that information. I’m happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Boz

customer_reviews.title: no worries I trimmed an inch off and it fit perfect. Assuming they were the exact same I trimmed ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one I ordered from here, the first one was a little long, no worries I trimmed an inch off and it fit perfect. Assuming they were the exact same I trimmed the exact amount off this one and it ended up being short the exact amount I trimmed. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon4Life

customer_reviews.title: improves his habitat
customer_reviews.text: our beardie has to live quarantined like us in the same place all the time. i know how he feels. so making his home clean and nice looking is an improvement to having the sunday ads on his floor. it stays put under his water and food dish. and gives him room to eat. i like it and believe he does too.
customer_reviews.author: K. Newcomb

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff! I have a 40gal breeder tank for my bearded dragon and I buy the 40/50 gal. Sometimes the carpet fits the tank perfectly when it comes in and other times it’s a bit long but I just cut it to fit. I probably wouldn’t get the 40/50gal size for anything larger than a 40gal. The carpet is easy to clean and machine washable and my dragon seems to like laying on it.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Kotten

customer_reviews.title: Bearded Dragon Tested: Approved
customer_reviews.text: I like using the reptile carpets, instead of the paper towel method. It’s very easy to clean when Spartacus decides to make a mess, this includes him tearing at a spot for an untold amount of time. The material was a little frayed but trimming it down with scissors solves any problem. I have had it for several months and have used the brand for years with now problem. The price is better then going to the reptile shows and buying the products.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Roland

customer_reviews.title: Makes for happy snake
customer_reviews.text: I’m a breeder and purchase about 120 plus rolls of this a month. For larger snakes you will need a lot of this product depending what you are doing with it . I’ve notice a huge change in all my pythons skin. It’s easy to remove and wash and then replace. I still replace the carpet every week to avoid them getting scale rot . Being a breeder I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Easy care/clean, always have a spare!
customer_reviews.text: Easy care, easy to clean, I recommens having at least two on hand (so you can have one ready while the other is washing. Machine washable, hang dry. Use perfume/dye/additive-free soap. May not be ideal for all reptiles. Make sure you are using the correct substrate for your pet.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Munsel

customer_reviews.title: Works fine as a mat for my rat cage
customer_reviews.text: Works fine as a mat for my rat cage, I can easily vacuum and rinse it out and am able to use it for a couple months. However, last time I purchased this item some parasites hitched a ride with the packaging, so I had to medicate my rats. Be aware of the risks when purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Emerald

customer_reviews.title: A great option
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to have a second liner for a Bearded Dragon cage. Just cut to fit and it works great. Now, I just pull one liner out and pop the replacement in. I can then clean the dirty liner at my leisure. I mean, my son can clean it, kids always clean up after their pets, right?
customer_reviews.author: Pinch

customer_reviews.title: this looks much nicer love the colour - but I’ve noticed our bearded dragon ...
customer_reviews.text: We usually buy the green one, this looks much nicer love the colour - but I’ve noticed our bearded dragon is catching his claws on this a lot. He’s 8 months old so maybe it’s due to him going through growth spurts - but this is first time we’ve tried the brown one, it just seems more fibery than the green. The box on this one was quite bashed and torn too. But outside Amazon packaging was perfect - so someone at dispatch sent this out in poor condition. The mat was ok tho.
customer_reviews.author: Harmony

customer_reviews.title: I can easily cut it to the perfect size for his glass ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to line my box turtle’s terrarium. If all the substrates I’ve tried in the past, this one I will order again and again. I can easily cut it to the perfect size for his glass enclosure. Unlike hay, mulch, even moss— my turtle never gets debris in his eyes when I line the cage with this. Best of all I throw it i the washer on hot every so often when it gets nasty. I can reuse a roll many times before needing more.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Too small for a 20 gal tank
customer_reviews.text: Well reading the description I imagined this would be more for a 20 gallon tank with the option to cut down if needed. I ordered the 15/20 gallon size assuming it would fit but it’s too short for our tank. I just pulled all the sand out and already threw it away before thinking I needed to measure. The material seems fine, from why I’ve seen and felt while placing it. Just super disappointed that it doesn’t fit my my sons new bearded.
customer_reviews.author: JPeebs

customer_reviews.title: Clean looking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my ball pythons cage to make it look cleaner but he hated it. I don’t think he liked the texture because he never came out of his hide and would barely move. Once I replaced it with the old substrate I was using he was active again. Wish he would have liked this miner because it made the cage look much nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Re-usable terrarium liner
customer_reviews.text: Perfect liner for my bearded dragon's 36"x 18" terrarium, easy to trim to size. I have purchased several and have been hand washing and line drying them for a month. I like the fact that they don't smell even after being used for a week and getting pooped on every day. Any liquid is absorbed easily with a paper towel and dries quickly. For comparison, I previously used walnut shells and sand and much prefer this terrarium carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Lara

customer_reviews.title: Great product...
customer_reviews.text: This company is different from what I'm used to. I have no issues with the item I purchased, but trying to return due to size (COMPLETELY my fault - I purchased too small) and I'm unable. Was refunded and now feel strange. Thank you, for sure...but I'm happy to return what I'm not going to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M. Cullum

customer_reviews.title: A must have.......
customer_reviews.text: Must Have. Why we ever buy the sand is beyond me. I only wish I found this sooner. Clean up is wipe and go. No scooping and cleaning every two weeks due to the smell. There is little to none smell on this mat after clean up. Sienna does not seem to mind it at all compared to sand. Definitely a plus with crickets. Easier to capture and no dead remains left in the sand. Would suggest for any bearded dragon owner who wants a cleaner environment for their beardie.
customer_reviews.author: Margie Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great value and product.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this before getting our new bearded dragon. It has been a life saver. It's easy to use and install. You just lay it down in the aquarium. Because it is rolled up is does curl at the edges. I just put some of his climbing sticks in the corners to eliminate this issue. I love the color. It is very natural. It is also easy to clean and even wash. Also it was half the price on amazon than in pet stores.
customer_reviews.author: N&N

customer_reviews.title: a must for leopard geckos and all reptiles
customer_reviews.text: did your local pet store tell you to get sand? me too, when I first got my reptile 8 years ago. Always research online before you get a pet! I have been using reptile carpet for years. Leopard gecko poop flies off, hardly ever sticks, and you can just wash it when you feel gross about it. I replace mine every few months, but you probably don't have to if you clean it regularly! (Use soap safe for reptiles of course and properly dry it)
customer_reviews.author: Connor & Lina

customer_reviews.title: Should fit tank better than it does.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, wish it was sized better. Have to cut to fit 20 gal tank and feels like a significant amount of wasted material. Able to get 2 reusable (not very difficult to clean and hang dry) floor mats for 20gal terrarium. Better pricing/value than the green colored version.
customer_reviews.author: allthatglitterz79

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Finally found one of these that’s the perfect size for my guys terrarium. Glad to not have to cut them down to size anymore. These are easy to clean but do drip forever when drying. Kinda pricey compared to substrate but reusable if you clean it right so there’s that as guess.
customer_reviews.author: Just-Mike92

customer_reviews.title: Great item. Early delivery. Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: ZILLA Terrarium Liners are the only substrate I will ever get for my beardies. They're the best. This purchase was a great experience. My package was a day early and the driver was kind enough to put it in a location out of view from the street. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Gilpin

customer_reviews.title: i think I loved the idea to have no sand and the housing ...
customer_reviews.text: i think I loved the idea to have no sand and the housing would be so much better. problem is that I didn't buy enough. you really need about 5 of these so you can clean off 1 while you put a fresh one in. and believe me. it will keep it not a lot of smell. so I would suggest you buy a few of them at a time. I gave it 4 stars because im not a fan of the texture. feels cheap. but looks pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: margaret miller

customer_reviews.title: Not great, but havent found better
customer_reviews.text: Have always gotten these. And always hate how no matter how long they are in the tank, they never fully unfurl. This makes it so crickets can easily get under the mat. They are too long for the tank, but better than too short. Have not found any mats that are better though.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda N.

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Used it to make substrate for above ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Used it to make substrate for above tank basking area for my turtle. I would definitely buy again. The section that sits in the water shows no problems.
customer_reviews.author: meccanoble

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: This carpet is great it fits my 40 gallon breeder perfectly I'd recommend it to any and everyone it's easy to clean too.!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Washable, reusable
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! The alternative was *not reusable and so this way we cut it in two and my son will remove, wash and dry the old mat and place the dry one in the cage with our gecko until the following week when he does it again. Very handy!
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: WARNING. CLAW SNAGGER!! (Doesn’t fit entire tank
customer_reviews.text: First things first. Please, if you care for you beardie do not use this. It snags their claws something horrible. My baby wouldn’t even come down off of her rock to poop from fear of her little claws being almost ripped off. Then, I have a 20 gallon tank and I really thought that this would cover the entire bottom of tank. Have about 6 inches uncovered. Also have to cut it to size other ways.
customer_reviews.author: Polo

customer_reviews.title: Use for my bearded dragon!
customer_reviews.text: My bearded dragon started having issues with the sand we were using(he would drag it into his water than drink his water and it would mess up his stomach) so we switched to this carpet and he seems to enjoy it more and hasn’t had any stomach problems
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Previously we have been using paper towels as substrate for our beardie, I have been debating between putting tile or repti carpet. I decided to give this a try, the fit was great. I have a 40 gallon breeder tank, and I only had to cut about an inch in the length for a perfect fit. I like the ease of cleaning it and the color compliments the desert background on the tank. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: jcaba

customer_reviews.title: Product works well, but delivery is horrible
customer_reviews.text: This review is for how the product came in the mail. It was only sealed on one side properly. The other side was completely open, and if there was anything of real value inside the box, it would have been stolen. Of course, to my bearded dragon, her carpet is of real value. As for the product, it works very well. You can wash it by hand or in the washing machine, and hang to dry. I have a few so it's easier to replace with a clean one when cleaning her tank.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole P.

customer_reviews.title: One time use only....
customer_reviews.text: Is great for Leopard Geckos as it does not loosen up where they could ingest it. However, a bit costly if you are cleaning your tank monthly and have to replace this each time. Price varies wildly as well. Overall I am satisfied but would be very satisfied if price was more reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: The Real Deal

customer_reviews.title: Seems rougher than Brown one.
customer_reviews.text: Seems fine. A little rough to the touch to me but maybe the Gecks like a little tummy scratches. I wasn’t careful enough and ordered a 20 not a 20L /so double check Your sizing needs. Way cheaper than in store
customer_reviews.author: Mommynator

customer_reviews.title: Wish it looked a little more realistic than just brown felt
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 90 gallon since I wasn't sure about the fit for the 75 gallon size. Its only 8 inches too short so I'll try the 75. I wish they would make them per tank dimensions and not by gallon since some are different dimensions but same amount of gallons.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Hammond

customer_reviews.title: A must for my beardy Snukums
customer_reviews.text: Easy Peasy clean up! I'm waiting for more to arrive any day now. Amazon is my only place to get it!
customer_reviews.author: bunyz

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the tan one?
customer_reviews.text: I bought both the green and tan versions of this size and the tan seems to be better. It is more dense than the green. Not sure if it varies per pack, but the two I compared felt and looked very different.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fox

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.text: Best bedding for rats ever!!! It doesn't get soggy, it doesn't stink, they chew it very little, and my vet says she prefers it for rats too. What's not to like? People on a rat fan Facebook page said it would be bad for them and they would get their little claws caught in it, but NOT SO. You can clip this whereever you want it, dump stuff off it easily into the trash, vacuum it still in the cage, and machine wash and dry it. The 125-gallon size fits my very large cages (including a Critter Nation). It is a bit long and has to be cut off, but the amount I cut off fits my Critter Nation pan.
customer_reviews.author: maewgirl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our bearded dragon!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for our bearded dragon. Generally, I have found this to be the easiest and safest substrate available. You don't have to worry about impaction and when it comes time to clean it, you just take it out and give it a thorough washing and done. Eventually, it will start to wear out, but I have saved a lot of money using this compared to natural substrates and my beardie seems just as happy.
customer_reviews.author: Don D

customer_reviews.title: Works great after alter
customer_reviews.text: Had to cut some length off but after that it is great. I got some double sided scotch take to line the edges because they were a little lifted up and live food would hide under it. Easy to clean I just use a vacuum hose and spot clean. Doesn't stain or hasn't yet. Started to smell after a month but I just took it out for an hour to air out and it was good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Lllb91

customer_reviews.title: Buy 2 to fit the tank.  It's worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this is good EXCEPT the size. I should've checked the dimensions... as the carpet wasn't large enough to cover the entire base of a 20 gallon tank! I had to patch the old carpet onto the new one. But with the price paid, I can't complain too much.
customer_reviews.author: Maridee L.

customer_reviews.title: Easier and cheaper than wood substrate.
customer_reviews.text: Use for snake cage flooring and lined inside of cages with it. Makes it easy to clean because you can just toss it in the washing machine. Also they use it while shedding because it snags their scales easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost :)
customer_reviews.text: The product is perfect!! I placed it for my iguana and its still intact from all his scratches from his long nails, and even when he goes potty the liner sucks it up and eliminates the stench!! Its worth it !!!! I recommend it :)
customer_reviews.author: JonathanCorrales

customer_reviews.title: Saved our pet!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 7 yr old leopard gecko who Stopped eating for months. I was advised to replace his sand with turf and within weeks he was eating like crazy. He may have been co Packed from licking the sand or digging and rutting for worms that escaped his dish.
customer_reviews.author: Missouri Mom

customer_reviews.title: A little small
customer_reviews.text: I love the breeze of clean up with this carpet, but buyer beware! If you are wanting to put this in a 20 gallon tank it ends up being 2 inches short on one side and a little too wide on the other! If you can, get the one from the same company specifically made for 20 gallons and it fits perfect, cleans up easy, and last a long time with no irritations to your reptile!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon McCrory

customer_reviews.title: Bearded Dragon substrate
customer_reviews.text: Using this for my Bearded Dragon in his 40B. Makes cleaning super easy. It was actually around 3 inches too long so I had to cut one end to make it sit flush with the terrarium bottom. Still a very convenient and safe Bearded Dragon substrate option.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use just put them down and when they get dirty I just throw them in the washer and hang dry them. There isn’t anything on them that your anima may invest and hurt them. I like to have two for when one is in the washer.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Kidd

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use, but the roll pattern seems to stick with the product, since i didnt put anything to weight it down it kept rolling it self backup, making it kind of useless for me. Other than that the product was easy to clean, it didnt have a noticeable odor which is great.
customer_reviews.author: S.C.

customer_reviews.title: Great substitute for paper towels without having to worry about ...
customer_reviews.text: Great substitute for paper towels without having to worry about my gecko eating her substrate (and looks better, too). Fits my ten gallon with a little bit of extra length that you can cut if you want. Easier to clean than paper towels or other substrates and if a bug gets out of your feeding dish you don't have to worry about them getting underneath it!
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Tad bit short for a 20 gallon long tank. But my beardie is comfy.
customer_reviews.text: Got the large for a 15-20 gallon tank they must mean 20 gallon tall. It was a bit short but not by much maybe 3 inches. But my beardie is so comfy and will not poop on it PERIOD he will wait to soak to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle E

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure to buy two or three, it's so easy to clean our terrarium now. We just remove everything clean the glass then lay a fresh piece in. The dirty one gets thrown in the wash and the spin cycle practically dries it out for next use. Plus you have the added benefit of not worrying about impaction.
customer_reviews.author: David Wooten

customer_reviews.title: Serves it's purpose.
customer_reviews.text: It does look like the image. I had to cut it to the size of my terrarium. It is almost plasticky to the touch. It looks pretty breathable, as there are places where the texture is thinner. I was using clay for lizard, this is cheaper, lighter, and easier to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is so much better than the sand that would give me an asthma attack every time I cleaned his terrarium. My dragon even seems calmer since I changed it out. If you are having doubts about using this, just try it. This product is super inexpensive and way better than any other substrate I've used before. I haven't seen his nails get caught on it yet as other have mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Better than sand
customer_reviews.text: Excellent flooring for a bearded dragon. I like the easy of cleaning up the stinky poo. The product can be cut really easily to make sure it fits properly in the enclosure.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: These are great!! They are so cheap that instead of cleaning it and putting it through the wash I just buy a bunch of them and use a new one whenever I clean my leopard gecko's cage. These are just perfect. I have bought so many of them and have never had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Harrold-Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install. Great product.
customer_reviews.text: After trying to find the best way to keep my geckos tank clean, I am so glad I found this product. Keeps odor to a minimum and easy to clean. No more paper towels. I have a small tank so I cut the mat in half. Will have this product for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Not good be careful!!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t like it for my leopard gecko every time he ate his mouth got stuck . The first time I had to help him loose.. I’m so worried now if he got some carpet in his mouth!! But I removed asap !! And it didn’t fit ten gallon perfectly!!
customer_reviews.author: DariLeo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, easy to clean, quality product, good price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit, a wee bit thicker than the one I has before and that's a good thing. Liquids repel from the surface slightly so I have a chance to wipe up with a paper towel before they soak completely through. I took a gamble today and washed it in my washing machine and then dried it for a few minutes on low heat and it worked perfectly, no shrinkage at all! In priced similar items at my local box box pet store and this listing's price is significantly better.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with this product. I was a little worried about the quality of the product given the low price. The product is great! I was using newspaper to line my bearded dragon’s tank, but after two and a half years of that I wanted something nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer B

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I already owned this product in green, but when I separated my leopard geckos I needed another and this was the least expensive place I have found it. The quality is what you would expect from Zilla, will last quite awhile with normal use. Easy to use, easy to care for. Wonderful product, and when purchased from Amazon, wonderful price as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tamra Benton

customer_reviews.title: Good reptile carpet
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have measured my tank first cause I thought it was 20L, but it came up 8-10 inches short for some reason. But that's not a big deal cause I put paper towels on the one side so my Bearded dragon can go to the bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Turtle power
customer_reviews.text: My turtle (Raphael) prefers the Zilla liners to anything else. More like moss & grass. Happy Turtle. Sorry, no picture. I don't have a smart phone--only a PC.
customer_reviews.author: StarOnFire

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for our Bearded Dragon in his/her 40 gallon breeder tank!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 40 gallon breeder tank and the fit from to back was perfect, but I had to trim a bit off the length. This adds a good look for the desert based bearded dragon we have and looks good in 'Little Monster's tank. Correction, we bought two...so we would have one to put back in the tank while cleaning the other. We also have one for the 10 gallon tank before Little Monster outgrew it.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, safe substrate for my bearded dragon
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful, safe substrate for my bearded dragon. No more paper towels! He has an Exo-Terra Large Wide and the width was perfect, I just had to trim a couple inches off the side which was very easy.
customer_reviews.author: ES

customer_reviews.title: The vet recommended it over sand because it's easier to keep clean
customer_reviews.text: The vet recommended it over sand because it's easier to keep clean. He said people don't change sand enough to be safe. I have two so I can change it out quickly and have plenty time to clean and dry the soiled one. He recommended laying it in the sun to dry as the sun will help kill the germs. The brown looks best for our bearded dragon because it looks more like his native desert environment.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy D.

customer_reviews.title: Great carpet for reptile enclosure, non-toxic and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd carpet I’ve bought. You need at least 2 (one for washing while other is clean and inside tank). I just built my dragon a new cage, needed another for his 2 shelves. Would keep buying if I need another one at some point.
customer_reviews.author: ShinedownAddict

customer_reviews.title: It's for a 50 long, but great quality
customer_reviews.text: Perfect if you have a 50 gallon long and not wide, if it's a 50 wide you'll need two carpets and to chop it up a bit. Overall very wonderful quality.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Michael

customer_reviews.title: Works well if you replace it often.
customer_reviews.text: My bearded dragon loves his carpet and seems to appreciate the brown color as opposed to the traditional green. Its not that easy to clean and for $8 I just replace it frequently as it never truly gets clean after repeated washings.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: It’s a must have
customer_reviews.text: 10/10 it was easy to apply and my beardie loves it. The loose substrate I used always made my asthma act up and her food would be covered in it. So I switched to this and it’s not pricey at all. I love it so far! I have a 40gallon so there’s a little extra carpet but I have heavy items to hold it down so it doesn’t matter
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Allen

customer_reviews.title: It's like a foam rug.  Would you want to live on a foam rug?  Tough question
customer_reviews.text: Used this for the bottom of tarantula terrariums, because I was running into a lot of mold trouble with coconut husk. I feel that the tarantulas did not like this material as much as natural plant matter and dirt. Their feet-claws would sometimes hook in ways that would cause them to walk awkwardly, unlike the typical graceful creep they'd usually crawl about with. After about a month of use, mold was still inevitable, congregating on droppings.
customer_reviews.author: az

customer_reviews.title: What happened to "prime" being two day shipping?
customer_reviews.text: Fair price. Shipping time a bit long, and unacceptable for "prime" delivery. About one inch too long, but thats better than too short.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: No memory, great carpet
customer_reviews.text: Great carpet. Comes rolled up but when unrolled it remains flat. Basically, it has no memory. Easy to cut. Will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: MyTwoCents

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to sand. Keeps the room cleaner.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for by fearded dragons 75 gal tank. They are easy to clean and easy to replace. Haven't had any issues. I would recommend only washing by hand or running them in the washer on delicate, then hang dry. One of mine warped a little cause it got in the dryer on accident. Still works though.
customer_reviews.author: ChampStamp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect by-gallon fit. Cannot clean.
customer_reviews.text: I always buy this carpet for my leopard gecko tanks. The nice thing about this brand, is that you buy it as the tank's gallon size and it fits perfectly. I've bought similar carpet from other brands and they do not fit the tank, so you end up having to cut them and bend them to fit. This one fits perfect and if well-kept can last a while, but they ARE difficult to clean. If you get Calcium powder or substrate on the carpet, it will look dirty, and you cannot clean it. I just buy new ones every few months, as they are affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good bedding option
customer_reviews.text: Placed it in my bearded dragons cage and even when his nails are fairly long, they don't get tangled in the strings. Droppings need to be cleaned asap of you'll need to wash it right away. My beardie had the runs once and it was impossible to clean without washing but it's understandable. The 40/50 gallon size fits just right
customer_reviews.author: William J. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: This substrate works great
customer_reviews.text: This substrate works perfect, my daughter likes using this one more then the substrate from the pet store. The quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

product_meta.title: Zilla Reptile Terrarium Bedding Substrate Liner
product_meta.description: Size:29-Gallon| Color:GreenBeginning pet owners and finicky reptiles alike will love Terrarium Liner. The owner simply rolls out the plush green or brown carpet and cuts to size as needed. Reptiles can thrive on the absorbent, non-abrasive material that wonâ€™t irritate sensitive feet. Best of all, the Liner is treated with a biodegradable enzyme that reduces reptile odors. At cleaning time, simply rinse with cold tap water and reuse. Ideal for starter kits, Terrarium Liner is a fuss-free product to introduce new customers to a reptile hobby.
feature_bullets: A low maintenance bedding, simply roll out and cut to size as needed
Safe because it cannot be digested like other substrates, a good alternative especially for juvenile reptiles
Treated with a biodegradable enzyme that reduces odors and is easy to clean with cold tap water
Absorbent, non-abrasive material will not irritate reptiles

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
